alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County; Orange; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:01AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lake and northwestern Orange Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 400 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leesburg Airport, or over Lake Harris, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Apopka, Leesburg, Eustis, Tavares, and Lady Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Northern Lake County; Orange; Southern Lake County
